course_title: Innovation and Entrepreneurship for Societal Impact

learning_outcomes.description: Clearly articulate personal values and how they can inform approaches to developing businesses that address community and global issues and outcomes.
Critically analyse a societal issue that can be addressed through innovation and entrepreneurship.
Collaboratively apply systems mapping techniques to articulate existing relationships between structures, stakeholders, and outcomes.
Develop an innovation/entrepreneurship approach to intervene at suitable leverage points for systems change.
Persuasively justify approaches to responsible systems intervention in the context of societal issues and outcomes, illustrating interdependence between social impact and business models.

assessments.assessment_title: Map the System Proposal & Group Update
assessments.due_date:
Map the System Worksheet 1 & 2 9/03/2026 3:00 pm

Map the System Worksheet 3 16/03/2026 3:00 pm

Map the System Project Proposal 23/03/2026 3:00 pm

This is a group assessment that involves completing preliminary systems mapping work (Worksheets) and articulating your initial research approach through both ongoing worksheet completion and a written proposal.

Group formation will be facilitated during the Seminar in Week 1. Groups will be formed primarily based on affinity of interests, but allocation will also be available. Please be mindful that groups must be finalised by Week 2.
assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Tutorial/ Problem Set
assessments.task_description:
This assessment is conducted in groups of 4-5 students and is comprised of two tasks:

  1. Students will complete Map the System modules 1-3 worksheets reflecting on personal values and interests in societal challenges, identifying areas of interest to explore systems change, and refining a research question and approach. These will guide team formation and Map the System topic choice for Assessment 2.
  2. Students will use the worksheets to develop a 1,300-1500 word Project Proposal due in Week 5.

Note that the groups will have an opportunity to present their proposals during the seminar of Week 3. This is an ungraded activity but a critical opportunity to receive formative feedback on the direction of the project, leading to Assessment 2.

Detailed assessment guidelines will be available on Blackboard.

AI Statement:

Note: This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.assessment_title: Map the System: Group Presentation and Report
assessments.due_date:
Map the System Worksheet 4 & 5 30/03/2026 3:00 pm

Map the System Worksheet 6 13/04/2026 3:00 pm

Map the System Report 27/04/2026 3:00 pm

Presentations During Class Week 9,
assessments.category: Paper/ Report/ Annotation, Presentation, Tutorial/ Problem Set
assessments.task_description:
This assessment is comprised of three tasks:

  1. Students are expected to complete and submit Map the System worksheets 4-6 during the seminars during weeks 4-6.
  2. Students will develop a Map the System Report, incorporating systems maps and synthesised research surrounding a chosen societal issue, exposing levers of change that are suitable for a social enterprise/not-for-profit to address, due week 9.
  3. Students will report on and defend findings in a 10-minute presentation & Q&A during week 9 and potentially Week 10 depending on the number of groups.

Detailed assessment guidelines will be available on Blackboard.

Please Note: The presentation will be recorded for marking purposes per UQ Policy.

AI Statement:

Note: This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
Purpose: The final exam for the MGTS7308 report assesses students' ability to integrate systems thinking theory, discussed in Weeks 1-9, with analytical, critical, and future-forward thinking applied to systems interventions reviewed in weeks 10-13.

The exam is scenario-based, closed-book and invigilated, but students are required to bring a hard copy of the system’s diagram they worked on, for Assessment 2. Students will be asked to analyse and critically reflect on how a systems mapping approach has supported understanding of how social enterprises can intervene in societal issues and identify any obstacles faced in applying systems mapping to a chosen issue.

AI Statement

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
What are social enterprises and not-for-profits?

An overview of the course, its content, and assessments.

Map the System Module 1 (worked individually), followed by group formation based on responses.

Learning outcomes: L01
learning_activities.topic_description: What are social enterprises and not-for-profits? An overview of the course, its content, and assessments. Map the System Module 1 (worked individually), followed by group formation based on responses.

learning_activities.topic:
Understanding Complex Social Problems

In this seminar, we will introduce systems mapping as a way of understanding complex problems, and focus on project areas for social enterprises and not for profits. We will begin to form teams and identify entrepreneurial opportunities.

Map the System Module 2 (worked in groups).

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Understanding Complex Social Problems In this seminar, we will introduce systems mapping as a way of understanding complex problems, and focus on project areas for social enterprises and not for profits. We will begin to form teams and identify entrepreneurial opportunities. Map the System Module 2 (worked in groups).

learning_activities.topic:
Adopting a Systems Approach

In this seminar, we will explore the dynamics of social problems through a systems lens. We will focus on understanding the constituent elements of a complex social problem for effective intervention by social enterprise and not-for-profits.

Map the System Module 3 (worked in groups).

Review of Assessment 1: informal presentation and feedback in preparation for the submission of Assessment 1 proposal.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L05
learning_activities.topic_description: Adopting a Systems Approach In this seminar, we will explore the dynamics of social problems through a systems lens. We will focus on understanding the constituent elements of a complex social problem for effective intervention by social enterprise and not-for-profits. Map the System Module 3 (worked in groups). Review of Assessment 1: informal presentation and feedback in preparation for the submission of Assessment 1 proposal.

learning_activities.topic:
Methods for Learning about Systems

In this seminar, we will examine different research approaches to understanding social challenges that social enterprises and not-for-profits might utilize.

Map the System Module 4 (worked in groups).

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Methods for Learning about Systems In this seminar, we will examine different research approaches to understanding social challenges that social enterprises and not-for-profits might utilize. Map the System Module 4 (worked in groups).

learning_activities.topic:
Tools for Systems Analysis Part 1

In this seminar, we will explore the Iceberg model to understand systems change and introduce systems mapping. 

Map the System Module 5 (worked in groups).

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Tools for Systems Analysis Part 1 In this seminar, we will explore the Iceberg model to understand systems change and introduce systems mapping. Map the System Module 5 (worked in groups).

learning_activities.topic:
Analysis for Action

In this seminar, we will discuss how to evaluate existing interventions that can support identifying levers for change for social enterprises and not-for-profits to act on.

Review of Assessment 2: informal presentation and feedback in preparation for the submission of report and presentations of Assessment 2.
learning_activities.topic_description: Analysis for Action In this seminar, we will discuss how to evaluate existing interventions that can support identifying levers for change for social enterprises and not-for-profits to act on. Review of Assessment 2: informal presentation and feedback in preparation for the submission of report and presentations of Assessment 2.

learning_activities.topic:
Social Impact and Business Strategy

In this session, we will explore how to connect intervention for a lever of change with an appropriate business model and compare the different approaches of social enterprises and not-for-profits.
learning_activities.topic_description: Social Impact and Business Strategy In this session, we will explore how to connect intervention for a lever of change with an appropriate business model and compare the different approaches of social enterprises and not-for-profits.

learning_activities.topic:
Exploring Interdependencies & Bottlenecks

In this seminar, we will explore how to analyse an approach to working with and through existing interdependencies to advance systems change.
learning_activities.topic_description: Exploring Interdependencies & Bottlenecks In this seminar, we will explore how to analyse an approach to working with and through existing interdependencies to advance systems change.

learning_activities.topic:
Unintended Consequences

In this seminar, we will discuss how to explore and manage unintended consequences.
learning_activities.topic_description: Unintended Consequences In this seminar, we will discuss how to explore and manage unintended consequences.

We will conduct a practice test and then conclude and summarize the course.
